headline: South Carolina Catfish Stew
name: South Carolina Catfish Stew
description: Loaded with bacon, potatoes, onions, and spices, this South Carolina catfish stew is simple to make and delicious to eat.
recipeIngredient: 1 cup hot pepper sauce (such as Frank's® RedHot)
12 ounces bacon, cut into 1-inch pieces, or more to taste
salt and ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Combine condensed soup, water, ketchup, hot pepper sauce, Worcestershire sauce, butter, and browning sauce in a stockpot over medium heat. Add potatoes, bacon, and onion. Season with thyme, chili powder, salt, and pepper; bring to a boil.

Meanwhile, rinse catfish and pat dry. Cut into bite-sized pieces and add to the stockpot. Reduce heat to a simmering boil and cook, covered or uncovered, until onions and potatoes are tender, about 25 minutes.
